paper_abstract: Geophysical flow simulations have evolved sophisticated implicit-explicit time stepping methods (based on fast-slow wave splittings) followed by time filters to control any unstable models that result. Time filters are modular and parallel. Their effect on stability of the overall process has been tested in numerous simulations. In this paper, we study the stability of the Crank-Nicolson-Leapfrog scheme with the Robert-Asselin-Williams time filter.
paper_title: Stability analysis of the Crank-Nicolson-Leapfrog method with the Robert-Asselin-Williams time filter
